page.title: 08Racal A Radar Factory
page.content: In 1977 the Radar Systems Division of MESL rented the factory,that Racal is now in,from the SDA.Racal moved into Linlithgow because MESL was expanding and needed more space. Racal employs 115 people and 40% of these live in Linlithgow.Racal makes ASMI,secondary,military and Miss distance radars.They supply the Ministry of Defence,British Aerospace,the Civil Aviation Authority and also foreign countries. Although they have no firm plans yet Racal would like to expand in Linlithgow.They take on YTS and had one in 1984 and one in 1985.There is also an apprentice scheme.There are three Racal firms in Scotland. 60% of the workforce in Linlithgow are engineers but they also employ inspectors,draughtsmen,accountants and managers.
